data.subject: DoDAF
data.evidence: The Department of Defense Architecture Framework (DoDAF) provides a comprehensive approach to enterprise architecture development.

data.subject: Operational View
data.evidence: The Operational View captures the operational aspects of the enterprise, including: OV-1: High Level Operational Concept Graphic

data.subject: System View
data.evidence: The System View describes the systems and interconnections supporting operational activities: SV-1: Systems Interface Description

data.subject: Technical View
data.evidence: The Technical View provides the technical standards and rules governing the implementation: TV-1: Technical Standards Profile

data.subject: Command and Control
data.evidence: The enterprise architecture must support various capabilities: Command and Control: Decision-making and coordination

data.subject: Intelligence Gathering
data.evidence: The enterprise architecture must support various capabilities: Intelligence Gathering: Information collection and analysis

data.subject: Logistics Operations
data.evidence: The enterprise architecture must support various capabilities: Logistics Operations: Resource management and distribution

data.subject: Communication Systems
data.evidence: The enterprise architecture must support various capabilities: Communication Systems: Information exchange

data.subject: Surveillance and Reconnaissance
data.evidence: The enterprise architecture must support various capabilities: Surveillance and Reconnaissance: Monitoring and detection
